item.title: POJ 1050 to the Max
item.description: Description Given a two-dimensional array of positive and negative integers, a sub-rectangle is any contiguous sub-array of size 1*1 or greater located within the whole array. The sum of a rectangle is the sum of all the elements in that rectangle. In this problem the sub-rectangle with the largest sum is referred to as the maximal sub-rectangle. As an example, the maximal sub-rectangle of the array: 0 -2 -7 0 9 2 -6 2 -4 1 -4 1 -1 8 0 -2 is in the lower left corner: 9 2 -4 1 -1 8 and has a sum of 15.
